headline.main: THE CITY FINANCES; Five Hundred and Twenty-six "Daniels Come to Judgment" Against the City--The Corporation Counsel and the Litigation of those Judgments.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: Like the old woman who had been "enjoying had health for many years," I may introduce myself as one who has long enjoyed the most dismal experiences of City law and City lawyers. It has been my unhappy fortune, every day, to sec fundamental provisions of the Charter contemptuously ignored;

docs.snippet: THE ANCIENT BRITON'S BENEFIT SOCIETY.--This Society. Instituted May 5, 1805, celebrated its Fifty-fourth Anniversary yesterday, at St. David's Hall, Canal-street. The President (W. M. JONES, Esq.) called the Society to order at 1 1/2 o'clock P.M.,...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE ANCIENT BRITON'S BENEFIT SOCIETY.--This Society. Instituted May 5, 1805, celebrated its Fifty-fourth Anniversary yesterday, at St. David's Hall, Canal-street. The President (W. M. JONES, Esq.) called the Society to order at 1 1/2 o'clock P.M., when the Secretary presented the fifty-fourth annual report, from which we gather the following facts:

docs.snippet: Mr. ELY reported complete the bill relative to reorganizing the Health Department of New-York under medical officers. The bill was ordered to a third reading. Mr. CHALEE. introduced a bill to extend the time for the collection of taxes in the whole...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. ELY reported complete the bill relative to reorganizing the Health Department of New-York under medical officers. The bill was ordered to a third reading. Mr. CHALEE. introduced a bill to extend the time for the collection of taxes in the whole State. The bill was intended to obviate the difficulty of the Governor's vote.
